Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam RW Arnsdorf

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am.

11:14 AM DA Calls case and states appearances. Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared by video.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Adam RW Arnsdorf.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court appears via ZOOM. DA Kelz states Victim Notifications have been complied with. Attorney Severson states a resolution has not been reached at this time and states he has a few things scheduled in regards to Assessments for his client and the time frame needed to complete those. DA Kelz makes comments. Parties discuss potential dates for another Status Hearing. Parties agree on 1/05/2023 at 10:00 AM.
Status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Order for release of discovery

2:21 PM COurt calls case and states appearances. Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared by video.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Adam RW Arnsdorf. DA Kelz states victim notification has been complied with. Court states it has signed the proposed order for discovery. Attorney Severson states he would like time to go over the State's offer and the materials he has requested. The courts sets 10/03/2022 at 11:15 AM for another Status Hearing. Defendant updates phone number on record.
Proposed Order for release of discovery
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:48 AM  (Judge and Court Reporter via Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared by video.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Adam RW Arnsdorf. Court states case and appearances.  DA states victim rights have been complied with.  Atty. Severson requests matter be scheduled for another status conference via zoom.  Court schedules case for another status hearing on August 11, 2022 at 2:15 via Price Co. Zoom.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Status hearing on July 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:42 AM Court calls case and states appearances. Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Adam RW Arnsdorf. Court addresses bond modification motion filed by Attorney Severson. Attorney Severson gives statements regarding the bond modification request. Court questions Attorney on defendant's employment, schooling, and prior criminal history. DA Kelz states victim notification has been complied with. DA Kelz gives statements in objection to the bond modification request. Court orders the Bond and its conditions will remain as is. If the Defendant is to bail out with the current bond it would be a condition that the defendant live with his father. Court addresses arraignment. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Attorney Severson requests a status hearing in 30 or 60 days. Court sets a status hearing for 07/01/2022 at 10:45 AM by Zoom.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Arraignment on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 02:01 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared via video from Price County Jail with attorney Brian William Severson who appeared in person.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Severson presents the court with a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Form signed by himself and his client. Court goes over the Waiver with the defendant. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court.   Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.   DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Attorney Severson requests an arraignment date. Scheduled for 05/25/2022 at 1:15 pm

10:08 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Adam RW Arnsdorf appeared, in custody via video means..  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Bond already set and is to continue.   Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits waived. Defendant comments on progress with SPD.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
Regarding bond- already addressed on 01/05/2022

9:47 AM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeares via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant in regards to letter correspondance for bond modification. Defendant comments. DA Kelz states he has not has a chance to review the correspondance from the defendant. Court provides DA Kelz with a copy of the letter and allows time for reading. DA Kelz objects to the modification and recites the charges and potential penalties from the probable cause/drafted criminal complaint on record. Court comments in regards to previously held bond hearing and addresses the basis needed to modify the bond already set. Court denies the request to modify the bond set on 12/15/202. comments by parties.
For bond modification hearing

Defendant may NOT have contact with anyone under age 18 other than, or unless
such contact is in a business or commercial or public setting and is part of a
commercial transaction.
 Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): A.L.C (DOB:05/29/2008)
unless a written waiver has been filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or the Price
County Sheriffs Department outside of normal business hours
 No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is
employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily
located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media,
email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this
order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate
circumstances.

10:34 AM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. ADA Mark T. Fuhr appeared for The State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 01/25/2022  at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Cash bond set
